item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 22, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Phased Array Microphone (2023) (222 points | 84 comments)
2. Understanding Google's Quantum Error Correction Breakthrough (55 points | 25 comments)
3. Show HN: A Marble Madness-inspired WebGL game we built for Netlify (354 points | 160 comments)
4. The Deceptively Asymmetric Unit Sphere (68 points | 17 comments)
5. Amazon to invest another $4B in Anthropic, OpenAI's biggest rival (332 points | 165 comments)
6. Translating My Grandfather's Biograpy (24 points | 3 comments)
7. Show HN: Rebels in the sky – Terminal game about space pirates (126 points | 40 comments)
8. FaSTer: Atari ST Digital Magazine (79 points | 18 comments)
9. Rendering "modern" Winamp skins in the browser (32 points | 6 comments)
10. From string to AST: parsing (2019) (83 points | 16 comments)
11. Wasp (YC W21) is hiring a framework engineer to build Laravel for JavaScript ( | hide)
12. Salmon return to lay eggs in historic habitat after dam removal project (254 points | 183 comments)
13. Pokémon Go Plot to Use Your Data to Fast Track an AI-Slop Google Maps Competitor (4 points | 1 comment)
14. Show HN: Llama 3.2 Interpretability with Sparse Autoencoders (515 points | 74 comments)
15. Autoflow, a Graph RAG based and conversational knowledge base tool (198 points | 30 comments)
16. OK, I can partly explain the LLM chess weirdness now (404 points | 361 comments)
17. Latest graphics driver for your Surface devices powered by Snapdragon X Elite (8 points | 3 comments)
18. How did you do on the AI art Turing test? (15 points | 5 comments)
19. Bayesian Neural Networks (226 points | 40 comments)
20. What's Next for WebGPU (179 points | 165 comments)
21. A “meta-optics” camera that is the size of a grain of salt (185 points | 119 comments)
22. A C++ Mixin System (48 points | 20 comments)
23. NeuralDEM – Real-Time Simulation of Industrial Particulate Flows (52 points | 10 comments)
24. MIT researchers develop an efficient way to train more reliable AI agents (14 points | 3 comments)
25. The FORTH code for Chipwits is released in the game's 40th anniversary (220 points | 63 comments)
26. Mechanically strong yet metabolizable plastic breaks down in seawater (110 points | 84 comments)
27. The meme-ification of the “Demon Core” (363 points | 266 comments)
28. Introducing Sill: Aggregate popular links on BlueSky and Mastodon (8 points | discuss)
29. The Surprising Social Lives of Pythons (14 points | 4 comments)
30. Show HN: OnePageGA – Simple dashboard for GA4 like Plausible (25 points | 19 comments)
